intro: Paepalanthus lepidus, commonly known as the silky puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces tall, flowering stalks that bear small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, dry conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
